summary:
AVAILABLE for new projects/missions/jobs. 
+447509779935 michael@quici.com http://consulting.quici.com

Senior IT Professional, offers a university education in ICT and 15+ years of work experience in  heterogeneous IT environments. Experienced as: Technical Business Analyst, System Integrator, Systems Engineer, Technical Application Manager, Application Support/Analyst.
Solid overall IT engineering know-how of IT concepts and processes, works on IT project streams in international environments and teams of professionals from different backgrounds. 
Experienced in applying different methodologies with strong conceptual and implementation skills.
Team player, ready to knowledge sharing, works with minimum supervision, maintains a high level of client satisfaction whilst following rules and regulations, never breaking boundaries.
Creative (but no cowboy), resourceful, relishes challenges, has high awareness of quality and meets aggressive deadlines.
Out of the box thinker, comes up with innovative solutions.
Strong ‘getting things done’ and ‘can do’ attitude, strives to raise the bar as mediocrity is not an option. Has skills and experience to be professional in any circumstance.

Specialties: Unix, Linux, Windows, business intelligence, data analytics, SQL, Shell, Excel, DWH, web/application servers, databases, ETL, programming, scripting, middleware, business process modeling and engineering, BPMN, Adonis, trouble-ticketing and tracking, stress testing, remote control, disaster recovery, versioning, packaging, monitoring, reporting, automation, CI/CD, tuning

projects.title: TLS Trading Limits System Prototype
projects.description:
To enable PB CRM Senior Mgmt an enhanced view on its derivative credit risk, a prototype was designed for the CH Lombard business building on the capabilities of strategic RDP (Risk Data Presentation). The prototype introduces new ways to look at risk, namely by allowing interactive drill down on EOD data from the top (i.e. Ressort) to bottom (i.e. Trade) and by introduction of new risk filters (e.g. Leverage and Concentration Risk). Datawatch is a complement to existing RiskSaver by increasing the capability to detect problematic portfolios at an early stage, ideally even before RiskSaver. 

The TLS Prototype was successfully deployed after several months of collaboration with CRO Change, TLS IT and PTG.

The prototype was built using strategic components in the presentation layer (secure RDA, RDP), approved interim components for data (Filebroker) and an early model of a small business-aligned Scrum team to deliver it.

Demos internal to the project team, user training and a quarter of testing would follow.

I was responsible for the Deployment in UAT/Prod and for the Filebroker interfaces setup.

volunteer_experiences.role: Eco Heritage Task Force participant in Pula and Zaostrog, Croatia
volunteer_experiences.description: The Croatian Heritage Foundation traditionally organises the volunteer TASK FORCE program, in which young people from the homeland and the emigrant communities work on preserving the environment, redeveloping derelict parts of Croatia's natural heritage, monuments, cultural and historical points of interest. The need to preserve natural and cultural heritage is a challenge. The involvement of youth is a natural necessity, as they hail from Croatia and endeavour to contribute to preserving its natural environment and wealth and to become better acquainted with it.

volunteer_experiences.role: Seminar Stvaranje kazališta participant in Zadar
volunteer_experiences.description: The Croatian Heritage Foundation stages seminars for leaders of theatre (dramatic arts) troupes active outside of Croatia, conceived as a workshop for the instruction of those who wish to expand on and enrich their knowledge, and for those who are looking to set up a theatre troupe. A lot of useful advice and practical knowledge is presented during the course of instruction, creative work and socialising. The seminar  is particularly useful to leaders of emigrant community theatre troupes active in a bilingual environment and multicultural milieu.

volunteer_experiences.role: Seminar Stvaranje kazališta participant in Zadar
volunteer_experiences.description: In the special ambience of the islet of Školjić, from July 8th to 16th, was held the summer project of the Croatian Heritage Foundation - STVARANJE KAZALIŠTA. This year, there were 20 attendees from Croatian emigration countries and neighboring BiH. The conductor of this particular amateur actors group was  recognized Croatian director Nina Kleflin.
